entry.title: Susceptibility of Canadian Seniors and Males to Varying Fraud and Scam Types

link.title: Susceptibility of Canadian Seniors and Males to Varying Fraud and Scam Types

entry.summary:
Abstract
Seniors within Canada are subject to a wide variety of scams and frauds. Seniors are also more or less vulnerable to certain scams. In the face of increasing automation, it is critical to explore current vulnerabilities to prepare for changing levels of scams. Seniors tend to lose more for most scams, especially scams done in person or using methods with an individual visible on the o...

entry.title: Senior vs Non-Senior Volunteerism In Alberta

link.title: Senior vs Non-Senior Volunteerism In Alberta

entry.summary:
Executive Summary
This analysis, based on the Government of Alberta’s 2023 Online survey, delves into age-based differences in volunteer engagement, motivations, and barriers between seniors and non-seniors. The findings were used to create strategies for nonprofit organizations to recruit and retain volunteers, with special attention to senior volunteers who contribute disproportionately to t...
